comment.author: 30126889@N08
comment._content: Is this still at Sunderland or is it the one I've seen at The Discovery museum?

comment.author: 49519336@N00
comment._content: Incredible that they allowed people to sit in it !

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content: Hi Paul, it is on display at Sunderland Museum and Winter Gardens, on what is known as the Museum Street.

comment.author: 23139050@N00
comment._content:
This was 1888. The rules have changed. Sitting in an artifact such as this is now known to be destructive. Just touching with the bare hand is known to be destructive!

Great photo though! Thanks for sharing all these wonderful photos!

comment.author: 62233671@N03
comment._content: It wouldn't just damage the artifact, but could also cause harm to the visitor. Many artifacts were treated with with dangerous chemicals including arsenic. Now museums often have education collections for the purpose of handling.
